formulas.name: fCloser
formulas.expression: CASE({!Engagement_Stage}, "Confirmed Adoption Won",{!$User.Id}, "Confirmed Will Recommend", {!$User.Id}, "Previous Adoption",{!$User.Id}, "")

formulas.name: fCloserDept
formulas.expression: CASE({!Dept_Stage}, "Confirmed Adoption Won",{!$User.Id}, "Confirmed Will Recommend", {!$User.Id}, "Previous Adoption",{!$User.Id}, "")

formulas.name: fIsWon
formulas.expression: IF( CASE({!varStage}, "Confirmed Will Recommend","TRUE", "Confirmed Adoption Won","TRUE", "Previous Adoption", "TRUE", "FALSE")= "TRUE",TRUE,FALSE)

fields.name: Depttext
fields.fieldText: Now we need to gather information for the department.

fields.name: Dept_Partner_Source
fields.helpText: Only use this if the adoption was reported by a partner.

fields.name: Display1
fields.fieldText: Cannot build opps for this role (Student, Librarian, Instructional Designer, Administrator)

fields.name: Engagement_Stage
fields.helpText: This flow is only for building opportunities won. Open opps will come later

fields.name: Partner_Source
fields.helpText: Only use this field if this adoption was reported by a partner

fields.name: End_Adoption_Date
fields.helpText: This is the date that the grad student is going to stop being a grad student or an associate professor teaching for this course.

fields.name: Nopenopenope_2
fields.fieldText: The book was not published, so we can't make an Opp won

fields.name: Nopenopenope_2_2
fields.fieldText: The book was not published so only an opportunity was made, not an IA.

fields.name: Nopenopenope_1
fields.fieldText:
This shouldn't happen. Stage was somehow entered wrong, even though you're given limited options.
Engagement Stage: {!Engagement_Stage}
